decks.notes: The main concept of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to put pressure on the opponent by playing aggressive creatures early in the game. The deck focuses on cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, Grief, and Fury to quickly deal damage and disrupt the opponent's hand. It also includes cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Orcish Bowmasters to further increase its aggression. Additionally, the deck includes disruption elements like Dauthi Voidwalker and Thoughtseize to control the opponent's resources. The deck also includes a small removal package with Lightning Bolt, Terminate, and Undying Evil to deal with threats.

This deck focuses on aggressive play and utilizing the Rakdos color combination. It is centered around strong aggressive creatures like Dauthi Voidwalker, Ragavan, and Orcish Bowmasters. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Grief and Thoughtseize to disrupt opponents' strategies. It has a strong removal package with cards like Fatal Push and Terminate. The main goal is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent, disrupt their game plan, and maintain card advantage with Fury, Fable of the Mirror-Breaker, and Not Dead After All. The deck also includes a few utility cards like Kroxa, Undying Evil, and Blood Moon to provide flexibility and disruption.

The key concept of this deck is to use the Cascade mechanic and aggressively cast spells with a low converted mana cost, triggering free spells from the deck. By cascading into cards like Violent Outburst and Shardless Agent, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flood of creatures from Crashing Footfalls and value from cards like Subtlety and Questing Beast. The deck also includes disruptive elements with cards like Force of Negation and Dead / Gone to control the game.

This deck focuses on control and utilizing the Scapeshift card to its advantage. It aims to control the board with cards like Supreme Verdict and Prismatic Ending, while also ramping up its mana with Leyline Binding and Wrenn and Six. The key strategy is to use Bring to Light to search for Scapeshift and combo it with Omnath, Locus of Creation and Dryad of the Ilysian Grove to quickly deal damage with landfall triggers. The deck also includes a mix of color-fixing lands to ensure consistent mana access.

This deck focuses on utilizing a combination of creatures and tools to create a powerful and versatile strategy. The key concept revolves around assembling different pieces of the combo to maximize efficiency and synergy. The deck includes a mix of creatures with various abilities, such as modular creatures like Walking Ballista and Grist, as well as toolbox creatures like Hapatra and Orcish Bowmasters. This allows for adaptability and the ability to respond to different situations. The deck also includes cards like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Agatha's Soul Cauldron to generate additional value and manipulate the board state.

This deck focuses on assembling a combo utilizing a toolbox of creatures. The key concept is to use creatures like Blood Artist, Orcish Bowmasters, and Yawgmoth, Thran Physician to gain value and control the game. The combo is enabled by cards like Chord of Calling and Agatha's Soul Cauldron, which allow for creature tutoring and sacrificing. Additionally, Grist, the Hunger Tide provides token generation and synergy with the combo. The deck also includes land cards like Boseiju, Who Endures and Khalni Garden to support the strategy.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo of equipping Colossus Hammer onto a creature and delivering a massive, unblockable attack. The deck achieves this by utilizing cards like Stoneforge Mystic, Puresteel Paladin, and Sigarda's Aid to efficiently find and equip the Hammer. Additional support cards such as Esper Sentinel and Giver of Runes provide protection and disruption, while cards like Springleaf Drum and Urza's Saga generate additional mana and artifacts to fuel the combo. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful, unexpected attack.

The key concept of this deck is to generate +1/+1 counters on creatures using cards like Hardened Scales and Zabaz, the Glimmerwasp, and then use those counters to fuel powerful abilities and create a threatening board presence. This is achieved through the synergy of cards like Arcbound Ravager, Hangarback Walker, and Walking Ballista, which can all benefit from the additional counters. The deck also utilizes artifact synergy with cards like Urza's Saga and The Ozolith, allowing for additional value and resiliency. Overall, the deck aims to aggressively build up a board state and overwhelm opponents with its growing creatures.

The deck focuses on aggressively putting pressure on the opponent through a combination of creatures, removal spells, and disruption. It aims to control the board state by using powerful cards like Tarmogoyf, Ragavan, and Orcish Bowmasters, along with spells like Unholy Heat, Lightning Bolt, and Fatal Push to deal with opposing threats. It also includes hand disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the inclusion of Urza's Saga and Mishra's Research Desk provides additional value and utility.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through countering and removing opponent's threats while building card advantage. It uses key control cards such as Teferi, Time Raveler and Supreme Verdict to control the board. The deck also utilizes powerful removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Solitude to deal with various threats. The inclusion of Leyline Binding and The One Ring adds a unique and powerful win condition. The deck also has a ramp element with Up the Beanstalk and Omnath, Locus of Creation to generate extra mana and maximize its control options.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize the Amulet of Vigor to generate extra land plays and to ramp into powerful threats like Primeval Titan. The deck focuses on playing lands with abilities such as Urza's Saga, Simic Growth Chamber, Golgari Rot Farm, and others. By generating additional land drops and untapping lands with the Amulet of Vigor, the deck can quickly assemble a mana base capable of casting Primeval Titan to search for key utility lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Vesuva. This allows the deck to generate powerful combo plays and overwhelm the opponent with big threats.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a combination of removal spells, card advantage, and planeswalkers. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's strategy by countering spells, bouncing problematic permanents, and disrupting their hand. It also focuses on ramping up mana to cast powerful threats and generate card advantage through cascading spells. With a diverse mana base, it aims to efficiently cast a wide range of spells. The deck's overall strategy is to maintain control of the board while generating value and eventually overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing the Cascade mechanic and the Beanstalk Giant card. The deck focuses on generating value and card advantage through Cascade effects, allowing the player to cast multiple spells for free or at a reduced cost. It also includes disruptive cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Elder Deep-Fiend to control the opponent's actions. The deck's mana base is designed to support a wide range of colors, enabling the player to cast spells from different color combinations.

The main concept of this Jund Aggro deck is to apply constant pressure on the opponent through aggressive creature attacks and efficient removal spells. The deck aims to efficiently disrupt the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while also maintaining card advantage with cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Wrenn and Six. The deck leverages the power of Urza's Saga to generate value and create threats, making it difficult for the opponent to stabilize. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion further enhances the deck's consistency and provides additional resources.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively gain life through various creatures and spells while also controlling the opponent's board. The deck utilizes cards like Giant Killer, Martyr of Sands, and Skyclave Apparition to remove threats and gain life. It also includes cards like Solitude and Ranger-Captain of Eos to provide additional utility and card advantage. The deck's win condition is supported by Elesh Norn, Mother of Machines and The One Ring. Meanwhile, cards like Reprieve and Abiding Grace help to protect the player's creatures and maintain a high life total. The deck also includes a land destruction theme with Demolition Field and Field of Ruin.

The main concept of this deck is to establish control over the game by utilizing UrzaTron, a combination of Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, and Urza's Mine, to generate a significant amount of mana. This allows the player to cast powerful threats like Wurmcoil Engine, Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, and The One Ring. The deck also includes various mana-fixing and card selection tools like Expedition Map, Chromatic Sphere, and Ancient Stirrings, along with powerful spells like Oblivion Stone and Karn, the Great Creator. Additionally, the inclusion of Boseiju, Who Endures and Blast Zone provides additional utility and protection.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower, and Urza's Mine) to generate large amounts of mana. This deck utilizes various artifacts and spells to search for and manipulate the Tron lands, while also using cards like Oblivion Stone and Relic of Progenitus to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes powerful threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Wurmcoil Engine to close out the game once the UrzaTron lands are assembled.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize the synergy between Amulet of Vigor and the land engine provided by Urza's Saga, Simic Growth Chamber, and Tolaria West to generate a large amount of mana. This is then used to quickly cast Primeval Titan and search for Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle, which deals damage to the opponent whenever lands enter the battlefield. Additionally, the deck employs cards like Arboreal Grazer, Azusa, Lost but Seeking, and Dryad of the Ilysian Grove to ramp and accelerate the mana production even further.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent's life total. It focuses on playing inexpensive and efficient red spells, such as Goblin Guide, Monastery Swiftspear, and Lightning Bolt, to put pressure on the opponent from the start of the game. The deck also includes burn spells like Lava Spike and Rift Bolt to deal direct damage to the opponent. Cards like Boros Charm and Lightning Helix provide additional burn and versatility, while cards like Searing Blaze and Roiling Vortex help control the opponent's board and disrupt their strategies. Overall, the deck aims to win the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize or set up their own win condition.

The key concept of this deck is to apply consistent and aggressive pressure on the opponent by rapidly dealing damage. The deck achieves this by combining efficient and direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt, Searing Blaze, and Lava Spike with fast and aggressive creatures such as Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Guide. It also includes cards like Boros Charm and Skullcrack to disrupt opponent's plans and prevent them from gaining life or stabilizing the board. The inclusion of Roiling Vortex further amplifies the deck's aggressive strategy by preventing opponents from gaining life and punishing them for casting spells.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures while utilizing the power of Death's Shadow. The key strategy revolves around reducing your own life total to make Death's Shadow stronger, while also using other efficient threats like Dragon's Rage Channeler, Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger. The deck also includes disruption and removal spells like Thoughtseize, Unholy Heat, and Lightning Bolt to control the game. Additionally, the inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional mana acceleration. Overall, the deck focuses on a fast and powerful assault, capitalizing on the strength of Death's Shadow.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently reanimate powerful creatures or spells from the graveyard using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate. By combining this reanimation strategy with the disruptive effects of cards like Grief and Solitude, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing a strong board presence. The deck also utilizes cards like Leyline Binding and Tainted Indulgence to control the opponent's hand and limit their options. Overall, the deck focuses on creating a powerful and unrelenting combo that can overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on a landless combo strategy. It aims to quickly mill cards from the library using cards like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer. This activates abilities from Vengevine and Narcomoeba, allowing them to be brought back from the graveyard. The deck also includes cards like Phantasmagorian and Thassa's Oracle to win the game once the library is emptied. It uses artifact mana like Talisman of Hierarchy and Pentad Prism to ramp up its mana production. The deck includes various utility cards and removal spells to support its combo strategy.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Cascade mechanic and cycling cards to quickly cycle through the deck, while also disrupting opponents. The key concept is to cast spells with Cascade to keep the opponent's board clear and control the game state. The deck incorporates cards like Shardless Agent and Violent Outburst to Cascade into Living End, which both clears the opponent's board and allows for powerful creatures to be brought back onto the battlefield. Additionally, the deck includes cycling cards like Street Wraith and Striped Riverwinder to help dig for key pieces and maintain a low curve.

The key concept of the deck is control through card advantage and disruption. The deck focuses on using cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils to limit the opponent's options and draw extra cards. Supreme Verdict and Solitude provide board control, while Counterspell and Force of Negation allow for disruption of the opponent's spells. Leyline Binding and The One Ring provide additional lockdown on the opponent's resources. The deck also includes a mix of fetch lands and triomes to ensure consistent mana base and resource access.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay, aiming to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Dragon's Rage Channeler to apply pressure early on. The deck also incorporates disruptive elements with cards such as Murktide Regent, Subtlety, and Counterspell to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, it includes burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat to efficiently remove threats. The deck further showcases card draw and selection through Mishra's Bauble, Preordain, and Expressive Iteration to maintain card advantage. It includes a toolbox of lands to ensure consistency and disruption while maintaining a swift tempo.

This deck focuses on playing control and disrupting the opponent's strategy. The main concept revolves around assembling the UrzaTron (Urza's Mine, Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant) to generate a large amount of mana. This allows for the deployment of big threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, Wurmcoil Engine, and Walking Ballista. The deck also includes a variety of artifacts and spells to control the battlefield, such as Oblivion Stone, Relic of Progenitus, Dismember, and Karn, the Great Creator. The goal is to outvalue and outlast the opponent while controlling the board.
